title: Cryo-Electron Tomography of Chlamydomonas reinhardtii: Leveraging Electron Event Representation (EER) Image Format in Visual Proteomics
content: Cryo-electron tomography (cryo-ET) and subtomogram averaging, combined with cryo-focused ion beam (cryo-FIB) milling, provide a groundbreaking approach to explore biomolecules within their native environment. Referred to as visual proteomics, this method enables visualization of biomolecular complexes within cells [1], unlike traditional structural biology methods reliant on solutions or crystals. Our pilot study with Chlamydomonas reinhardtii [2], a unicellular green alga, aims to unravel high-resolution cellular structures, inspiring large-scale studies across species.
